DataElement.preferredName: Patient Neuropsychology Test Consent Withdrawn Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no/not applicable indicator that asks whether the patient has withdrawn consent for the neuropsychological tests of the study

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A branch of psychology which investigates the correlation between experience or behavior and the basic neurophysiological processes. The term neuropsychology stresses the dominant role of the nervous system. It is a more narrowly defined field than physiological psychology or psychophysiology._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something._When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A branch of psychology which investigates the correlation between experience or behavior and the basic neurophysiological processes. The term neuropsychology stresses the dominant role of the nervous system. It is a more narrowly defined field than physiological psychology or psychophysiology.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.:When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.

Concepts.definition: The study of how the physiology of the brain and central nervous system are related to behavior.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.
When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.
